title: Strictly spin-off host Rylan breaks silence and says Zoe Ball 'bust-up' never happened
text:
Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Strictly Come Dancing spin-off presenter Rylan Clark-Neal has broken his silence on a rumoured bust-up with co-host Zoe Ball and insisted it never happened.

Former X Factor star Rylan, 30, was said to have fallen out with Zoe, 48, after they clashed during rehearsals for It Takes Two on Friday.

However, Rylan is adamant the rumoured argument never took place because he wasn't even at rehearsals that day.

During an appearance on Sunday Brunch today, Rylan explained: "I’ve just joined Strictly with the lovely Zoe.

"It’s been amazing. It’s such a beast that show. I’ve worked on big shows like Big Brother and X Factor but the fans of Strictly are on it.

"There’s a story this morning that said me and Zoe had a big bust up in rehearsals on Friday. A big old bust-up.”

(Image: Channel 4)

He continued: “I was late. I missed rehearsals. I was flying back from my big DJ gig. So its news to me."

The Sun on Sunday reported the feud broke out after Zoe jokingly told Rylan to "shut up" when he disrupted her during rehearsals on Friday.

An insider said: "Rylan wasn't filming but he was 'performing' for the crew - telling jokes and laughing noisily. He was being very loud and Zoe snapped.

(Image: BBC)

It was obvious Rylan took offence.

"You could cut the atmosphere with a knife..."

They added: "But they are both complete professionals on screen."

description: Rylan Clark-Neal has denied claims he's fallen out with his It Takes Two co-host Zoe ball after clashing in rehearsals
